column5: That just about sums it up!!!!
a picture says a 1000 words...  that picture could be mine too  it was great to meet you

oh wow.. i was sure hoping that on the sunday morning you were to get out and get something... but on the bright side.. you got that honking big yo-suri now.. !!  it was nice meeting you glen, you're one hell of a guy./   kevin

Well to bad about the fishing glen...but hell it was still fun,and im glad i finally got to meet you,and make sure you bring that big honkin lure for next year   !!!!! maybe it scared to fish...LOL..LOL. see ya next year bud !!!!
Yeap, that was a strange smell in my boat  too
Come on Terry...what you talking about..you got a 14lb x 30" FISH ! lol  Good to see ya again Glen!
That'll teach him for not taken me with him
~~~It was great meeting you Bud,  glad you got home okay, hope tp meet you again
I'm confused  What's this, chopped liver?    Joey
Quote:  "I'll post pics of that fish with the rightful owner as soon as I get them loaded."  Ah, I missed that part, thanks Cliff.  Joey

Yesterday, 09:57 PM Post #15   All Knowing Angler   Greencoachdog Group: Members Posts: 4,014 Joined: 15-November 06 From: Way Down Yonder in the Land of Cotton Member No.: 23   Quoted from Glen......... I just love reading other peoples Skunk reports...   So do I Glen
Glen, I love your new format of the fishing reports. What a time "saver" I'm going to use it in 2008

Well, glad you made it home safe and sound ... we didnt want any international incidents (you're somthing of a National treasure when you cross that border  ... anyhow sorry about the skunk .. but glad you made it through the 'brisk' weekend without any blatant (public) nudity ... thanks for that
Ya big whimp .... Take your shirt off before taking the pics.   Gosh ... don't even recongize ya. Good you were able to make it up with safe driving. Hope to see ya again in June.

It was great to see you again Glen. We didn't end up fishing together but I'm sure we will have a chance to get skunked together in the future. Thanks again for the drift sock, that was very generous of you! -Brian
